item.title: Maggie add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Gordon A. Eadie
item.description: "If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything." -- Gordon A. Eadie

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Maggie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I was gratified to be able to answer promptly, and I did. I said I didn’t know." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson
